sentences.en: A cool breeze made the heat pleasantly bearable.
sentences.cn: 一阵凉风吹来，让炎热的天气变得稍微舒适了一些。

sentences.en: Bearable at the moment , but it gave me hell all night.
sentences.cn: 现在还受得了,昨天夜里一直疼得很.

sentences.en: He found the dullness of his work scarcely bearable.
sentences.cn: 他觉得他的工作枯燥乏味,简直无法忍受.

sentences.en: His friendship was the one thing that made life bearable.
sentences.cn: 有他的友情在，生活还可以过下去。

sentences.en: Jaywalking and cutting lines when boarding trains are bearable.
sentences.cn: 红灯还爱闯马路就算了,坐捷运不排队也罢.

sentences.en: She said to the doctor that her pain would be bearable.
sentences.cn: 她告诉医生说她的疼痛勉强可以忍受.

sentences.en: She says to the doctor that her pain will be just bearable.
sentences.cn: 她告诉医生说她的疼痛勉强可忍受.

sentences.en: She was the only thing that made life bearable.
sentences.cn: 只因有了她生活才可以过得下去。

sentences.en: So I went back to school and it was just about bearable.
sentences.cn: 于是,我又返回了学校,对此我几乎可以忍受了.

sentences.en: Someone once categorized marriage into four types — hateful, bearable , manageable, and satisfactory.
sentences.cn: 有人曾把婚姻分为四种:可恶的婚姻 、 可忍的婚姻 、 可过的婚姻和可意的婚姻.

sentences.en: The bearable or manageable marriages, in most cases, are just like this.
sentences.cn: 可忍或可过的婚姻大抵也是如此, 当事人稍一怠慢,它可能很快就会枯萎 、 凋零.

sentences.en: The camaraderie among fellow employees made the tedious work just bearable.
sentences.cn: 同事之间的情谊使枯燥乏味的工作变得还能忍受.

sentences.en: The money made life more bearable for her.
sentences.cn: 这笔钱使她的日子还过得去.

sentences.en: What is total cost for each participant that you think is bearable?
sentences.cn: 每人参与项目的总费用在多少范围内你认为是可以接受的?

words.tran_cn: 持票人；[建] 承木；[机] 托架；送信人；搬运工人

trans.tran_cn: 可忍受的，可容忍的，忍得住
trans.tran_en: something that is bearable is difficult or unpleasant, but you can deal with it
